Title: The Stranger
Author(s): Albert Camus; Matthew  WardÂ (Translator); Albert Camus
Genre(s): Classics; Fiction; Philosophy; France; Literature; Novels; French Literature
column9: Published in 1942 by French author Albert Camus, The Stranger has long been considered a classic of twentieth-century literature. Le Monde ranks it as number one on its "100 Books of the Century" list. Through this story of an ordinary man unwittingly drawn into a senseless murder on a sundrenched Algerian beach, Camus explores what he termed "the nakedness of man faced with the absurd."
